intro: Erodium foetidum subsp. celtibericum, commonly known as the stinking eryngo, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, pink to purple flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and other open areas. It has a distinctive, often unpleasant odor, which is most noticeable when the leaves are crushed. This subspecies is known for its adaptability and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
